title: Gap metrics for stationary point processes and quantitative convexity of the free energy
summary: This article investigates convexity properties of the free energy for stationary point processes on $\mathbb R$ using a new geometry inspired by optimal transport. It demonstrates quantified strict convexity of the free energy, implying uniqueness of minimizers, and the existence of a gradient flow curve that converges exponentially fast to the unique minimizer for a rich class of pairwise interaction energies.
usefulness_reason: The paper is directly focused on "stationary point processes", which is a core concept within "Point Process". While it doesn't explicitly mention spatio-temporal aspects or contextual/survey data, its fundamental contribution to point process theory makes it highly relevant to the overall query.
